articles.title: UACT organizing father/daughter dance, tickets now on sale

articles.author: Kyle Bailey For The News-Review
articles.description: CANYONVILLE — Tickets are now on sale for the 55th annual Greatest of the Grape event.
articles.title: 55th annual Greatest of the Grape tickets on sale

articles.author: Kyle Bailey For The News-Review
articles.description: ROSEBURG — Stewart Park Drive Bridge in Roseburg will be closed to vehicle and pedestrian traffic during a maintenance inspection on Thursday.
articles.title: Maintenance inspection to briefly close Stewart Park Drive Bridge

articles.author: Kyle Bailey For The News-Review
articles.description: ROSEBURG — The Umpqua Valley Audubon and Roseburg Public Library invite the public to a presentation on great horned owls by Colorado researcher Scott Rashid.
articles.title: Partnership to host great horned owl researcher

articles.author: Kyle Bailey For The News-Review
articles.description: ROSEBURG — The Roseburg Public Library invites the community to enjoy “The Power of Place,” a photography exhibit currently on loan from the Oregon Historical Society.
articles.title: Roseburg library hosts photography exhibit

articles.author: GLORIA COLEMAN The News-Review
articles.description: A Beginning Youth Shotgun Skills event will be held all day Feb. 14 at the Roseburg Rod and Gun Club, 875 Old Del Rio Road in Roseburg. The event is put on by Friends of the NRA and Douglas County…
articles.title: Beginning Youth Shotgun Skills event is Feb. 14

articles.author: GLORIA COLEMAN The News-Review
articles.description: The Oregon Department of Education, in partnership with the Oregon Lottery, will accept nominations for Regional Teacher of the Year through Feb. 11.
articles.title: Oregonians welcome to nominate teachers for Oregon Regional Teacher of the Year

articles.author: GLORIA COLEMAN The News-Review
articles.description: The University of Wisconsin-Madison recognized students who achieved the dean's list for the fall semester of the 2025-26 academic year.
articles.title: University of Wisconsin-Madison recognizes Combs on dean's list

articles.author: GLORIA COLEMAN The News-Review
articles.description: The Umpqua Literacy Council opened the 2026 Celebration of Literacy Poster Contest for all students from kindergarten through fifth grade. Posters are due Jan. 30.
articles.title: 2026 Celebration of Literacy Poster Contest opens submissions

articles.author: GLORIA COLEMAN The News-Review
articles.description: York University announced 180 students listed on the Fall 2025 Term Dean's List. Moriah Hoshowski of Roseburg was named on the list.
articles.title: Hoshowski named on York University dean's list

articles.author: GLORIA COLEMAN The News-Review
articles.description: The Oregon Department of Agriculture is accepting nominations for International Year of the Woman Farmer 2026.
articles.title: Oregon Department of Agriculture accepts nominations for International Year of the Woman Farmer

articles.author: Nathan Wilk KLCC
articles.description: The National Labor Relations Board (NLRB) has cleared Oregon-based drinks distributor Bigfoot Beverages of several accusations that it violated labor law.
articles.title: Bigfoot Beverages cleared of multiple labor complaints raised by striking workers

articles.author: ANDREW GRIFFIN The News-Review
articles.description: WINCHESTER BAY — In 1894, the wick of the rebuilt Umpqua River Lighthouse was lit for the first time, guiding sailors through the mist and fog of the Oregon coast.
articles.title: Umpqua River Lighthouse celebrates over 130 years of operation

articles.author: ANDREW GRIFFIN The News-Review
articles.description: Reedsport’s Stillwagon Distillery is an institution of two personalities. On one side, guests are welcomed into the easygoing tasting room, a tiki bar that feels like it was picked up from a tropical island and dropped onto the Oregon coast.
articles.title: Sustainability, creativity, drinkability: Inside Stillwagon Distillery

articles.author: Jim Teece
articles.description:
Southern Oregon University’s project to create an older adult living community on its Ashland campus has been paused after one of the two companies being considered as partners with the university withdrew its response to SOU’s request for proposal. SOU will take time to consider what potential partnerships may look like before possibly issuing a new request for…
The post Plans paused for older adult living community at SOU appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.
articles.title: Plans paused for older adult living community at SOU

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Wildlife Safari has completed a brand new lemur house in the free Walk Thru Safari. The larger, heated space includes big windows and can be divided for new introductions or maternity needs. The lemurs have returned to their updated island home.
articles.title: New Lemur House Completed at Wildlife Safari, Lemurs Return to Walk Thru Safari

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Roseburg police arrested Alan Daniel Hubschman, 34, after officers reported he stole a loaded firearm from a vehicle at Waldron’s. Police said he was located in a tent on a walking bridge and the firearm was recovered.
articles.title: Man Arrested After Reported Firearm Theft From Vehicle at Waldron’s Outdoor Sports

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Roseburg police reported multiple arrests and citations Jan. 21–22, including a parole warrant arrest, a probation violation, a firearm theft investigation, a disorderly conduct arrest, and a burglary case involving stolen tobacco products.
articles.title: Police Log: January 21, 2026

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: The Roseburg Receiver Morning Scoop
articles.title: January 22, 2026

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Source One Serenity founders Rusty and Elena Lininger presented Douglas County Commissioners and Solid Waste staff with a certificate of appreciation, thanking them for support that helped launch a food waste diversion and compost project at the Glide Transfer Station.
articles.title: Source One Serenity Honors Douglas County Leaders With Certificate of Appreciation

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Reedsport Main Street advanced to the Designated Main Street level in the Oregon Main Street Network, along with Downtown Medford Association, North Bend Main Street, and Port Orford Main Street. OMS said the designation reflects progress in strengthening historic downtowns.
articles.title: Reedsport Main Street advances to “Designated Main Street” level in Oregon Main Street Network

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Douglas County commissioners issued a proclamation Jan. 21, 2026, declaring January as National Human Trafficking Awareness and Prevention Month. The proclamation cites the TVPA and recognizes the Douglas County Human Trafficking Task Force and its partner agencies.
articles.title: Douglas County Declares January as Human Trafficking Awareness and Prevention Month

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Congress approved the FY26 Interior Appropriations Bill with language that AOCC says restores a 75% share of BLM O&C timber receipts for 18 western Oregon counties. The group says the change reverses a 1982 revision and could boost annual revenue by about 50%.
articles.title: Congress approves FY26 Interior Appropriations bill with changes to O&C timber revenue share for Oregon counties

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Roseburg police arrested a 32-year-old man after officers reported he pointed a BB gun at a woman, demanded her wallet, and later contacted her about the case. He was lodged at Douglas County Corrections on robbery, weapon, and witness tampering charges.
articles.title: Roseburg Man Arrested After Alleged BB Gun Robbery, Witness Tampering

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Roseburg police reported multiple arrests and citations in the latest logs, including a first degree robbery allegation involving a BB gun, several warrant and probation contacts, and city ordinance cases such as prohibited camping and leash law violations.
articles.title: Police Log: January 20, 2026

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: North Umpqua Outfitters is offering a free guided fishing trip on the Umpqua River for veterans and first responders. The drift boat outing includes fishing gear, lunch, and drinks, and lasts about 5 to 6 hours. Participants must bring an Oregon fishing license and Salmon Steelhead tag.
articles.title: North Umpqua Outfitters Offering Free Umpqua River Fishing Trip for Veterans and First Responders

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Umpqua Community College women’s basketball coach Dave Stricklin earned the 1,000th win of his junior college career Jan. 19 as the Riverhawks beat Portland Community College 89-60. UCC will recognize the milestone with an on-court ceremony Jan. 25.
articles.title: UCC Women’s Basketball Coach Dave Stricklin Earns 1,000th Career Win in Riverhawks Victory

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: North Douglas County Fire & EMS received two SPIRE grants from Oregon Emergency Management, funding new Holmatro battery rescue tools for vehicle extrication and a thermal imaging drone to boost search and rescue and scene awareness. Crews are now training with the equipment.
articles.title: North Douglas County Fire & EMS Receives Two SPIRE Grants for New Rescue Tools and Thermal Drone

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Adapt Integrated Health Care says a vendor-related security incident at TriZetto may have involved some patient info, including names, SSNs, and insurance details. Adapt systems were not breached. Impacted patients will be notified starting Feb. 2026.
articles.title: Adapt Integrated Health Care Notifies Patients of Vendor-Related Security Incident Involving TriZetto

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: The Roseburg Receiver Morning Scoop
articles.title: January 21, 2026

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Bigfoot Beverages says the NLRB dismissed seven unfair labor practice charges filed by Teamsters Locals 206 and 324, calling them lacking in merit. The strike began Sept. 19, 2024, and continues as the labor dispute remains unresolved.
articles.title: NLRB Dismisses Union Complaints Against Bigfoot Beverages, Company Says

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Roseburg police reported multiple arrests Jan. 16 to 20, including DUII cases, warrants and parole violations, alleged assaults and harassment, restraining or no contact order violations, theft at WinCo, and several criminal mischief and prohibited camping incidents, according to city logs.
articles.title: Police Log: January 16 - January 20, 2026

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Roseburg volunteers marked MLK Day with hands-on service across Stewart Park, Eastwood Nature Park, and the Duck Pond, removing trash, pulling invasive plants, and installing educational signs as part of Umpqua Watersheds’ annual restoration event.
articles.title: MLK Day of Service Brings Roseburg Together for River Cleanup and Invasive Species Removal

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: The Roseburg Receiver Morning Scoop
articles.title: January 20, 2026

articles.author: News Staff
articles.description: Stewart Park Drive Bridge will be closed for a maintenance inspection on Thursday, Jan. 22.
articles.title: Stewart Park Drive Bridge in Roseburg closes for inspection Thursday
